\bentry
\word{hell}
\pron{helf}
\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{\num{1} perxVtaloVka; maqtara loVka.
\num{2} naraka; shAshavxta shikeSxge guriyAda AtamxgaLu matutx dudeRVvategaLu yAtaneyananxnuBavisuva loVka.
\num{3} dwSaTxyXda yA duSaTxtanada yA saMkaTada -- sathxLa, sithxti.
\num{4} (\AmA) (AshacxyaR yA kirikiriyanunx sUcisalu baLasuva udAgxra) hALu; aniSaTx: \eng{what the hell do you want?} hALAdudx Enu beVku ninage? \eng{who the hell are you} hALAdavanu niVnu yAru?. 
\num{5} (pirxsanarfsx beVsf \mo\ ATagaLalilx) baMdigaLanunx kUDuva koVSaThx.
\num{6} jUjumane.
\num{7} (\ame, \AmA) tamASe; egugxsagigxlalxda vinoVda, kuceVSeTx.}}

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\dictmeaning{\num{1} \eng{a hell of noise} sahisalAgada,
 vipariVta -- galATe.
\num{2} \eng{all the hell let loose} shudadhx
 goMdala, avAMtara, galaBe.
\num{3} \eng{a \textit{or}} (\ame) \eng{one \textit{or}} (\birx) \eng{the hell of a
 \textit{or}} \eng{helluva} = \hyperlink{hell nuga17}{\nuga $(17)$.}
\num{4} \eng{as hell} tiVra; ati: \eng{tired as hell} tiVra AyAsagoMDu.
\hypertarget{hell nuga5}{}
\num{5} \eng{beat the hell out of} cenAnxgi, balavAgi gududx hAku.
\num{6} \eng{be hell on} (\ashi):

\alnum{a} apirxyavAgi vatiRsu; kaTuvAgi naDeduko; koVpa toVru;
noVyisuvaMte vatiRsu: \eng{she's hell on her servants} avaLu ALugaLa
bagegx bahaLa kaTuvAgi naDedukoMDaLu.

\alnum{b} apAyakAriyAgiru: \eng{these
country roads are hell on tyres} I haLiLxgADina rasetxgaLu TeYrugaLige
apAyakAri.
\num{7} \eng{catch hell} = \hyperlink{hell nuga10}{\nuga $(10)$.}
\num{8} \eng{come hell or high water}EneV, eSeTxV aDiDxAtaMkagaLu barali
lekikxsade.
\num{9} \eng{for the hell of it} keVvala vinoVdakAkxgi,
tamASegAgi.
\hypertarget{hell nuga10}{}
\num{10} \eng{get hell} bayugxLa tinunx; bayiyxsiko;
cenAnxgi CiVmAri mADisiko: \eng{he'll get hell from his wife for
 coming so late again} matetx aSuTx hotAtxgi, hotutx miVri
barutitxruvudakAkxgi avana heMDatiyiMda avanu
bayiyxsikoLuLxtAtxne.
\num{11} \eng{give (a person) hell} (yAvudeV
vayxkitxge) taDeyalAgada kirukuLa koDu; goVLuguTiTxsu; piVDisu;
kATakoDu; sahisalAradaMte mADu.
\num{12} \eng{go to hell!} hALAgi hoVgu!
\num{13} \eng{hell and high water} yAvudeV bageya yA parxmANada
aDiDxAtaMkagaLu, kaSaTxgaLu, kelxVshagaLu:\eng{led his men through
 hell and high water} elalx riVtiya kaSaTxgaLalUlx avanu janarige
dAri toVridanu.
\num{14} \eng{hell around} (\ashi) saMyama biTuTx
vatiRsu, jiVvisu; hucAcxbaTeTx vatiRsu; poVkariyAgi naDeduko,
baduku: \eng{all they cared about was drinking and hell in around}
avarige beVkAgidudxdu kuDiyuvudu matutx hucAcxbaTeTx vatiRsuvudu
mAtarx.
\num{15} \eng{hell for} (yAvudAdarU oMdara bagegx) bahaLa
kALajiyuLaLx; bahaLa Asakitx, sharxdedhx iruva: \eng{he was hell for
 efficiency} avanige dakaSxteya bagegx tiVvarx
Asakitxyitutx.
\num{16} \eng{hell for leather} pUtiRveVgadalilx;
hucAcxpaTeTx veVgadalilx.
\hypertarget{hell nuga17}{}
\num{17} \eng{hell of a} (\ashi) 

\alnum{a} cenAnxgilalxda; keTaTx; ahitavAda; saribiVLada; kaSaTxda; parxyAsada:
\eng{we had a hell of a trip on that bumpy road} etetxtitx hAkuva A
rasetxya meVlina parxvAsa namage bahaLa parxyAsavAyitu.

\alnum{b} asAdhAraNa; atishayavAda; aduBxta; amoVGa: \eng{he got a great
 applause after giving a hell of a speech} amoVGavAda BASaNa mADida
naMtara avanige mecicxke doreyitu.

\alnum{c} tuMba; bahaLa; BAri; ati; vipariVta:
\eng{it was a hell of a lot of money for a movie} bariV oMdu
calanacitarx noVDalu adu tuMba duDuDx.
\num{18} \eng{hell to pay} bahaLa kaSaTx; PajiVti; takakx shAsitx:
\eng{if he's late there'll be
 hell to pay} avanu hotutx miVri baMdare avanige bahaLa kaSaTx
kAdide.
\num{19}\eng{knock the hell out of} = \hyperlink{hell nuga5}{\nuga $(5)$}.
\hyperdef{H}{hell nuga(20)}{}
\num{20} \eng{like hell} (aneVka veVLe AdhikayxsUcakavAgi):

\alnum{a} (\AmA) EnanUnx lakaSxyX mADade; elAlx Ase toredu.

\alnum{b} (\AmA) vipariVtavAgi; mitimiVri; asAdhayxvAgi: \eng{he ran like hell} avanu
vipariVta veVgavAgi ODida.
\num{21} \eng{not a hope in hell} EneVnU avakAsha ilalx; adara AseyeV ilalx.
\hyperdef{H}{hell nuga(22)}{}
\num{22} \eng{play (merry) hell with} (\ashi) nilaRkaSxyXdiMda vayxvaharisu; toMdareyanunx yA
apAyavanunx uMTumADu; avayxvasethxgoLisu; asatxvayxsatxgoLisu:
\eng{heavy rains played hell with the flow of traffic} BAri maLeyiMda
vAhana saMcAra asatxvayxsatxgoMDitu.
\num{23} \eng{raise hell}:

\alnum{a} yadAvxtadAvx maja mADu.

\alnum{b} gulelxbibxsu; goMdalavanunxMTumADu; koVlAhala huTiTxsu;
raMpa mADu; galATe mADu; parxbalavAgi AkeSxVpisu: \eng{she will raise
 hell when she sees what your dog has done to her 
 garden} avaLa toVTadalilx ninanx nAyi mADiruva hAvaLiyanunx
noVDidAga Ake BAri raMpa mADuvaLu.
\num{24} \eng{ride hell for leather}:

\alnum{a} (\sA\ kudure savArana \vi) pUNaRveVgadalilx ; ati
hecicxna veVgadalilx; tuMba joVrina veVgadalilx; dwDAdwDiyalilx:
\eng{we saw two horsemen riding hell for leather on the plain} ibabxru
kudure savAraru meYdAnadalilx BAri veVgadiMda kudure ODisikoMDu
hoVgutitxdudxdanunx nAvu noVDudevu.

\alnum{b} AdaSuTx jAgarxteyAgi; sAdhayxvAdaSuTx beVgane.
\num{25} \eng{the hell} = \hyperlink{hell nuga27}{\nuga $(27)$}:
\eng{get the hell out of here!} tolagihoVgu ililxMda hALAdavane!
\num{26} \eng{the hell you say} adu tiVra AshacxyaRkara; bahaLa
soVjigavAgide.
\hypertarget{hell nuga27}{}
\num{27} \eng{to hell} hALAgihoVgali; nAshavAgi
hoVgali: \eng{to hell with it!} hALAgi hoVgali adu!
\num{28} \eng{what the hell} (\AmA) (yAvudeV kaSaTx yA aDiDxyanunx lakiSxsade) Enu mahA?
Enu naSaTx?:\eng{what the hell, I can go tomorrow instead} Enu mahA!
(ivatitxge) badalu nALe hoVdarAyitu.
\num{29} \eng{who the hell, who is the hell, is he?} yAravanu, A hALAdavanu?}

ninanx sithxti heVgide? }}
